TF038685-BOSNIA-HERZEGOVINA:  ENTERPRISE
            & BANKING PRIVATIZATION ADJ. CR.,TF037391-BOSNIA & HERZEGOVINA -
            ENTER & BANKING PRIV,TF036856-BOSNIA-HERZEGOVINA - ENTERPRISE
            AND BANKING PRIV. ADJ. CREDIT,TF023283-DUTCH GRANT FOR BHZ'S EBPAC,TF029669-PHRD-STRUCTURAL ADJUSTMENT PROGRAM

abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the Enterprise &
            Banking Privatization Adjustment Credit Project for Bosnia
            and Herzegovina was satisfactory, the sustainability was
            likely, the institutional development impact was
            substantial, and the Bank and borrower performance were both
            satisfactory. The lessons learned indicate that a complex
            adjustment project in terms of sector coverage and country
            conditions can be successful despite a marginal quality at
            entry assessment if the government commitment remains high
            and is demonstrated through key policy actions. Supervision
            of the project is flexible in terms of responsiveness to the
            borrower's changing situation and intensive in terms of
            monitoring and adherence to priority conditions. For initial
            adjustment credits in private sector development, it is best
            to set conditions for the first tranche release that do not
            involve major actions that are likely to be controversial
            delaying the start of the project. Establish a viable
            implementation timeline for privatization adjustment
            operations. Recognize the advantages of strategic
            privatization and need for expert privatization assistance
            early in the project preparation.
